name: What is This Color? Quiz | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: What shades of color are crimson, maroon, and ruby?
questions.explanation:
Red.

	Crimson is red with a hint of purple. Maroon is brownish red color. Ruby is a pinkish red.

questions.text: What is the color of most judges' robes?
questions.explanation:
Black.

	Black is the most common color of a judge's robes. It is the absence of color. Black is the color used in most printing, and for mourning and to represent death.

questions.text: What is the color of most canaries and daffodils?
questions.explanation:
Yellow.

	Yellow is the most common color of both canaries and daffodils. It is associated with gentleness and humor but also is related to cowardice and Judas Iscariot.

questions.text: What color is associated with a suntan?
questions.explanation:
Brown.

	Brown is the most common color of hair and eyes. It is the color you are trying to achieve when you tan in the sun (although make sure you wear sunscreen!). It is associated with plainness and poverty.

questions.text: What color do we often associate with envy?
questions.explanation:
Green.

	Green is the color we associate with envy or jealousy. Green is also associated with environment, the Irish and youth. It is made by mixing together blue and yellow.

questions.text: What color do you get when you mix red with blue?
questions.explanation:
Purple.

	when you mix red and blue you will get purple. This color is associated with royalty as for a long time purple dye was extremely rare. It is the color of eggplants, amethyst, and some grapes.

questions.text: What color does people's hair often turn as they age?
questions.explanation:
Gray.

	Gray is the color that is a mixture of black and white. Many older people have gray hair. Gray is associated with modesty, neutrality and boredom. It is not one of the most popular colors.

questions.text: What color is most common for a carrot or pumpkin?
questions.explanation:
Orange.

	Many fruits and vegetables are orange in color. These include sweet potatoes, carrots and pumpkins. Orange is found between red and yellow on the spectrum of visible light.

questions.text: What is the color of the sky on a clear weather day?
questions.explanation:
Blue.

	Blue is a primary color that is associated with both the sky and the sea. It is a common color of human eyes.  Some studies have shown that it is the most popular color in the world, with half the people surveyed choosing it as their favorite color.

questions.text: What color is considered to be the opposite of black?
questions.explanation:
White.

	White is considered to be the opposite of black. It is associated with innocence, purity and honesty. It is the color of chalk, snow and milk.
